channel.title: RSBuffer issue
channel.description:
After looking at this once again for about 3 hours I did a little more changing around and got it to go further then before, log in still won't work to its fullest but this time I am getting errors with the log in on the client and server meaning I can find a real fix. Sadly I can't think of what is wrong?
Server CMD: [code]ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:4668 Client type: high memory version dataFileVersion[0]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[1]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[2]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[3]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[4]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[5]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[6]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[7]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[8]: 0x0 Ident: ☺¡°6fgdhhdfd:dghdfghfg inStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x3101d9e inStreamSessionKey[1]: 0xdaa2c3 inStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x3ca354c inStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x4c7a2b0 outStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x3101dd0 outStreamSessionKey[1]: 0xdaa2f5 outStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x3ca357e outStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x4c7a2e2 Server: Exception! java.net.SocketException: Software caused connection abort: socket write error at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0(Native Method) at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(Unknown Source) at Client.parseOutgoingPackets(Client.java:95) at Client.process(Client.java:155) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:165) at Server.main(Server.java:26)[/code]
Server Main code: [code] playerHandler.process();[/code]
PlayerHandler code: [code] while(players[i].process());[/code]
Client Process code: [code] parseOutgoingPackets();[/code]
Client parseOutGoingPackets: [code] public void parseOutgoingPackets() { // relays any data currently in the buffer if(writePtr != readPtr) { offset = readPtr; if(writePtr >= readPtr) numBytesInBuffer = writePtr - readPtr; else numBytesInBuffer = Config.BufferSize - readPtr; if(numBytesInBuffer > 0) { try { // Thread.sleep(3000); // artificial lag for testing purposes out.write(buffer, offset, numBytesInBuffer); readPtr = (readPtr + numBytesInBuffer) % Config.BufferSize; if(writePtr == readPtr) out.flush(); } catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) { Misc.println("Server: Exception!");// This can happen on log out __ex.printStackTrace(); disconnected = true; } } } }[/code]
In the client I get either T1 or T2 errors.
Client CMD: [code] Welcome to EndoScape Error: T1 - 194,0 - -1,-1 Error: T1 - 178,0 - -1,-1 Error: T1 - 184,0 - -1,-1 Error: T1 - 88,0 - -1,-1[/code]
I am not to sure what I have to change to get log in to fully work. :(

item.title: RSBuffer issue
item.dc:creator: @mattfitz mattfitz
item.description:
@mattfitz wrote:

did anyone actually find the solution to this??? because mine is doing it

item.title: RSBuffer issue
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

After looking at this once again for about 3 hours I did a little more changing around and got it to go further then before, log in still won’t work to its fullest but this time I am getting errors with the log in on the client and server meaning I can find a real fix. Sadly I can’t think of what is wrong?

Server CMD:

ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:4668 Client type: high memory version dataFileVersion[0]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[1]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[2]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[3]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[4]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[5]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[6]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[7]: 0x0 dataFileVersion[8]: 0x0 Ident: ☺¡°6fgdhhdfd:dghdfghfg inStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x3101d9e inStreamSessionKey[1]: 0xdaa2c3 inStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x3ca354c inStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x4c7a2b0 outStreamSessionKey[0]: 0x3101dd0 outStreamSessionKey[1]: 0xdaa2f5 outStreamSessionKey[2]: 0x3ca357e outStreamSessionKey[3]: 0x4c7a2e2 Server: Exception! java.net.SocketException: Software caused connection abort: socket write error at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0(Native Method) at java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocketOutputStream.write(Unknown Source) at Client.parseOutgoingPackets(Client.java:95) at Client.process(Client.java:155) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:165) at Server.main(Server.java:26)

Server Main code:

playerHandler.process();

PlayerHandler code:

while(players[i].process());

Client Process code:

parseOutgoingPackets();

Client parseOutGoingPackets:

public void parseOutgoingPackets() { // relays any data currently in the buffer if(writePtr != readPtr) { offset = readPtr; if(writePtr >= readPtr) numBytesInBuffer = writePtr - readPtr; else numBytesInBuffer = Config.BufferSize - readPtr; if(numBytesInBuffer > 0) { try { // Thread.sleep(3000); // artificial lag for testing purposes out.write(buffer, offset, numBytesInBuffer); readPtr = (readPtr + numBytesInBuffer) % Config.BufferSize; if(writePtr == readPtr) out.flush(); } catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) { Misc.println("Server: Exception!");// This can happen on log out __ex.printStackTrace(); disconnected = true; } } } }

In the client I get either T1 or T2 errors.

Client CMD:

Welcome to EndoScape Error: T1 - 194,0 - -1,-1 Error: T1 - 178,0 - -1,-1 Error: T1 - 184,0 - -1,-1 Error: T1 - 88,0 - -1,-1

I am not to sure what I have to change to get log in to fully work.

Read full topic
